item.name: Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions Committee

item.title: To amend the Head Start Act to require parental consent for nonemergency intrusive physical examinations.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Education Reform.

item.name: Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions Committee

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S12293)

summary.text: Amends the Head Start Act to require Head Start agencies to obtain written parental consent before administration of any non-emergency intrusive physical examination of a child in connection with participation in a Head Start program.

bill.title: A bill to amend the Head Start Act to require parental consent for nonemergency intrusive physical examinations.

item.title: A bill to amend the Head Start Act to require parental consent for nonemergency intrusive physical examinations.
A bill to amend the Head Start Act to require parental consent for nonemergency intrusive physical examinations.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
